title: Rumbles Flamespitter does now full damage to minions. Is this the only change for his Q?
body: Meddler told us that they are going to buff Rumbles Q. This is probably the best thing happened in a long time for me I mean that Flamespitter does full damage to minions? But is this the only change to his Q? Just asking :)

replies.body: Isn't this just going to pretty much remove lane interaction with rumble completely. It already feels low when he's just constantly shoving you in.

My assessment was that most people will still just have a reasonable chance to fight him. He has to stand close to the minion wave to push all of it, and most top laners match up decently against him.  On Live, he had pretty poor wave manipulation and last hitting abilities, and below average dueling capability against his popular opponents.  His gank escape tools also generally below par (esp. if he's focusing on pushing a wave up), so calling in assistance could be an option if the need arises.  

Definitely something we're going to be keeping our eye on.

This is really amazing to hear.
I'm trying my best not to be biased but this post puts a smile on my face.

Also, since I've been looking to get an answer for a long time about this:
Would you guys ever consider adding more effects to his basic abilities in the DangerZone rather than just a 50% Numbers/Slow ramp-up?

I feel his DangerZone passive leaves a lot more to be desired considering the supposed learning curve of him.

Even when I get fed in games, I find myself a lot with lacking enough tools to support my team by attempting to make plays with him, even with all the knowledge I've gained from maining him for a long time.
For a champion that lacks mobility and has mainly strong Damage Scalings, if you're being focused, either I do enough damage and attempt to kite(lol it's hard due to lack of sufficient mobility, even at the smallest amounts) to live, or I die before I can even do 1% of damage to everyone trying to kill me because my spells are mainly DoT.

I fully understand his niche as a champion but if I could make my personal voice heard: I'd like Rumble to be more versatile in different match ups and still competent regardless of team-comps. Obviously some teams compositions will remain a lot stronger than others, regardless I still stand by my stance.

What about Rumble's Q damage in jungle? Still reduced?

Rumble in the Jungle isn't super-powerful compared to primary junglers.

That's the only chance we've currently got planned for Rumble's Q yeah. We'll probably reduce his ult CD slightly as well.

There's also some wider stuff that should have a noticeable indirect impact on Rumble - nerfs to a couple of things he doesn't use that other people he often lanes against do (Grasp, Iceborn).
Assuming that these aren't enough to make him a good top laner again, which I think is a fairly likely scenario, is there anything else that is planned or being tested for him?

A champion's biggest damage source, and main source of wave clear/push, doubling in damage against minions is a fairly substantial change, particularly given it also makes last hitting noticeably easier (something Rumble has a rough time with). It's certainly possible he'll need further changes, wouldn't want to assume anything there though, this is very much a 'assess again after the changes have been out a patch or two' situation.

If these changes put him overboard in the top lane somehow can you refrain from just lowering the damage on his Q or something to compensate for the double damage to minions? I personally enjoy playing him in the jungle a lot this season and would like to see that playstyle intact without any unnecessary nerfs.

What's your opinion on Rumble post 6.9 MYMU? Do you think that the new items/changed items (most notably the fact that now he has access to cdr) will put him overboard, or do you think he won't stand out too much?

Keep in mind CDR's power is limited by overheating

Of course, he can't make full use of cdr like everyone else. But the main reason why would you want cdr on Rumble would be lowering your ultimate cd, which is something he needed ever since 5.16. Now with Equalizer being available more often he's gonna create a lot more pressure on the enemy team. But then, I wouldn't say it's at a ridiculous level, more like "equal" (WHAT A PUNTASTIC PUN)
Thanks for the answer! This change is great and I hope its enough for Rumble to get back to meta. also those grasp/gauntlet nerfs are great for him!

Speaking of Rumble, will his Q bug be fixed on Super Galaxy Rumble? Basically he cannot use an empowered Q if his Heat is 45 or 40 when it starts decaying rapidly, like when it is still yellow, but he can use his other abilities just fine. Anything regarding that?
That is helpful but wont bring him back into the meta. AD is still too powerful.

I don't think it's really that much of a buff. Rumble's Q great strength currently is that it harasses without pushing the lane more than necessary. Toplane is a lot about control of the wave, and if Rumble has to autopush to trade, it's more of a weakness than anything.

The other buffs happened several patches ago actually. That's when people started picking him in the jungle for a patch.

They made it have slightly faster tic rates (which means more consistent damage if you're moving around)
